definition: to press down/to calm/to subdue/to suppress/to guard/garrison/small town/to cool or chill (food or drinks)

sentences.english: The woman behind me, whoever she is, whispers about sedatives.
sentences.chinese: 我後面的女人，不知道是誰，悄聲說着鎮靜藥。

sentences.english: Depressants are alcohol, barbiturates and sedatives.
sentences.chinese: 抑制藥有酒精，巴比妥酸鹽和鎮靜劑。

sentences.english: Dantes listened to these melancholy tidings with outward calmness .
sentences.chinese: 丹特斯聽取這些傷心的消息時外表很鎮靜。

sentences.english: Marty tried to keep his head during the fire.
sentences.chinese: 馬帝在火場中試圖保持鎮靜。

sentences.english: But she kept calm amid all these excitements.
sentences.chinese: 但她在所有激動面前保持鎮靜。

sentences.english: A certain amount of dreaming is good, like a narcotic in discreet doses.
sentences.chinese: 一定程度的夢想，正如適量的鎮靜劑，是好的。

sentences.english: No pregnant women use any analgesic or hypnotic agent. 2h.
sentences.chinese: 術前2小時內未用任何鎮靜或止痛藥物。

sentences.english: Tranquillizers help alleviate the distressing symptoms of anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 鎮靜劑有助於緩解焦慮所帶來的不安症狀。

sentences.english: Conclusion FBCS possesses the sedative and hypnotic effects.
sentences.chinese: 結論冬蟲夏草發酵液具有一定的鎮靜催眠作用。

sentences.english: The effects of sedation may make you forget what you were instructed after the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 鎮靜作用可能會讓你忘記醫生在造影檢查後的指示。

sentences.english: Stillness has a calming effect on the world around us as well.
sentences.chinese: 在這個世界上，在我們周圍，靜有一種鎮靜的效用。

sentences.english: Lincoln was very surprised, but he pretended to be calm.
sentences.chinese: 林肯非常驚訝，但是他假裝鎮靜自若。

sentences.english: They claim Murray administered a fatal dose of propofol and other sedatives.
sentences.chinese: 他們聲稱莫里給了傑克遜一劑致命的麻醉劑和鎮靜劑。

sentences.english: You probably already know that exercise is better than tranquilizers for relieving anxiety and stress.
sentences.chinese: 您可能已經知道，運動比鎮靜劑更能緩解焦慮和壓力。

sentences.english: Sedation amnesia and slow induction in pernasal intubation was an effective way for the operation.
sentences.chinese: 鎮靜健忘慢誘導經鼻插管是一種比較好的方法。

sentences.english: I turn and do my best to smile and look calm and ask what's the matter.
sentences.chinese: 我回過頭努力力地微笑，並故作鎮靜地問有什麼問題。

definition: to reduce the pressure (of a fluid)/to lower one's blood pressure/to lower (or step down) the voltage
to ease (tension)/to relax/to cause sth to relax/to alleviate/relaxed/easy and unhurried/leisurely/soothing/mild (slope)
to refresh and clear the mind (idiom)/invigorating/bracing
to stretch taut/(of muscles etc) taut/strained/tense
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
to smear/to apply glue or ointment to a surface
